documents.document: I would say Logic is the right tool for the job. It's overkill for any one thing really, but that's why it's awesome https://t.co/D2x0oAohVR
It's still the same compressor. Let me know if you have any questions :-) https://t.co/bLj2rAErVE
Love it. Let me know if you have any Logic questions :-) https://t.co/UtjOH2mrrY

Just added you on FB. Happy to help :-) https://t.co/sdCahmynDS
I've been using it for years. It's awesome. Let me know if you have any questions. https://t.co/1i7fQLqsWJ

Logic Pro X is awesome! https://t.co/ZeRuLyQ9QU
Love it. Let me know if you have any Logic questions. https://t.co/yFR8hOqq2H

Self-audit.
Cut out the stuff that didn't work.
10x on what did.
Repeat.
Unlearn your fear of failure https://t.co/dnkETpaHse
Yes! You're welcome. Anytime :-) https://t.co/AiNKWZ4COM

Select All (cmd-a) then turn on cycle region (yellow bar top of arrangement) https://t.co/BZaJZTHNit
Then bounce https://t.co/EAO9KuxtWw
That's weird. Try again but have the cycle region cover all of the regions. https://t.co/WKkMYswy9t
Oh ok. Export the audio file to your desktop then drag it into iTunes. https://t.co/n0yJCMtIuD
@B_Reyes8 in the bounce menu, there is 'add to iTunes' https://t.co/1TaCSi0hHp
Could you send me a screenshot of your session please? Also, Logic plug-ins are pro. Price does not equal value. https://t.co/FK67PP1206
How long has this been happening for? https://t.co/GiNmTUQyxT
How can I help? https://t.co/pykWfQHVeB
You're welcome, man! https://t.co/MGMyzeUFlz
If you don't use it already, Parallel Processing will take a load of your CPU: https://t.co/S3G7Md3Nqk https://t.co/xDJUxoCOE8
You're welcome! Have a lovely day! https://t.co/sRLggAnhHm
Price is what you pay. Value is what you get. https://t.co/CqPShLU2Lw
Yes, like I said, the plug-ins will contribute to the sound. Not the DAW itself. Big difference. https://t.co/ZUfS6c8xM3
DAWs don't sound different. The sound is in the recording, the process, and plug-ins used. Not the DAW https://t.co/RzKF9KyICp
They all encode audio the same way. The sound comes from the synths, the instruments, and how they are used. https://t.co/OPP1q8rAwl
Keep up the good work! Feel free to AMA! https://t.co/DnAeYJUIiu
A great way to start one's journey. I started with FL and soundforge. Simpler times. https://t.co/PACOdtN74n
I hear you bro! Pretty much sums up my education! https://t.co/qeVA8oT2ve
Tell me about it. I'm forever burning the midnight oil. Hours spent mixing. Love it! https://t.co/5xQsBCoU1s
Thanks! Happy producing! :-) https://t.co/VaMZmTkcqF
No worries. Always feel free to reach out! https://t.co/U7K7ueymCJ
@pflame64 @OppBloodOnMy30 A hit can be made in any DAW. It's the producers, no t the tech that makes the music.
Write them down also! https://t.co/71wUjIvxTm
Awesome! Keep up the good work and let me know if you have any questions :-) https://t.co/3Lapvk5Qnq
The lines themselves don't but if they fall in between notes in Flex Pitch then you can quantise them back into key https://t.co/XbTT5UVypi
More than happy to help! Is there anything in particular you need to work on? https://t.co/Wn5osT45za
Have you tried freezing tracks? https://t.co/Pw5iagpwBF

Keep up the good work, @vegafall https://t.co/9cUwPHJsRe

@Rawdecmusic it's such a game changer. I made a tutorial about it where I make a bussed delay line. Feel free: https://t.co/gk4XmWOHao
@Haycan Thanks for sharing :-) Here's another - Parallel Delay: https://t.co/gk4XmWOHao
@IAMROCCITBOY Parallel Processing is a game changer. I made a tutorial about it where I created a bussed delay line. https://t.co/gk4XmWOHao
@BusyWorksBeats it's such a game changer. I had to make a tutorial for it. In this example, I make a bussed delay https://t.co/gk4XmWOHao

I want to connect with every #MusicProducer on Twitter so I can HELP as many people as possible and LEARN as much as possible.
I make tough decisions because I have #goals

The worst decision is to not make one at all.
#life #decisions
Ok cool. Many start with @FL_Studio as it's very intuitive and affordable. It's a great DAW. Many great prod use it. https://t.co/6DSBv6HwQb
Absolutely. Loads of producers use laptops. What style you making? https://t.co/GJggGA6MAO
Mac or PC? https://t.co/MqzOTMw5tL
Fair enough. I suppose it incentivises you to make decisions quickly, which can be a good thing :-) https://t.co/JQ6VQHgI8b

Just had a great catch up with my good friend @alikiaudio
Never forget to engage with people who can stretch you.
#MusicProduction
